scenario_tester.or_create_custom: Or create a custom one below
scenario_tester.regenerate_hands_tooltip: For predefined scenarios only. Generates new random hands that fit the scenario's rules.

parda_y_gano.title: Parda y Gano (Tie and Win)
parda_y_gano.description: The first trick was a tie. The AI is hand for the second and holds a strong hand. The goal is for the AI to recognize that winning this trick wins the round and to call Truco for maximum points.

do_or_die.title: Do-or-Die
do_or_die.description: The AI is about to lose the game. The opponent calls Truco. Folding is a certain loss. The AI must ignore its hand weakness and accept, as it's its only chance to win.

lopsided_bait.title: Lopsided Hand Bait
lopsided_bait.description: The AI has a very high Envido (31+) but very poor cards for Truco. The optimal strategy is to not call Envido and play a low card, hoping the opponent calls so it can be counter-attacked.

envido_primero.title: Envido Primero
envido_primero.description: The opponent calls Truco. The AI has an excellent Envido (33+). The correct rule/strategy is to interrupt with 'Envido is first' to secure those points before resolving the Truco.

flor_vs_envido.title: Flor vs. Envido
flor_vs_envido.description: The opponent calls Envido. The AI has Flor. The rule is that Flor voids and beats Envido, so the AI must respond with 'Flor'.

endgame_pressure_truco.title: Endgame Pressure
endgame_pressure_truco.description: The AI is about to win (14 points). It has a decent but not unbeatable hand. The goal is for the AI to play conservatively and avoid calling Truco, not risking the game unnecessarily.

explanations.see_opponent: A standard opening play when not 'mano' (hand). The AI plays its lowest card to see what the opponent does without revealing strength or wasting a good card.
explanations.probe_low_value: A strategic bait. The AI plays its weakest card to hide its overall hand strength and encourage the opponent to bet or make a mistake.
explanations.probe_mid_value: A more advanced bait. The AI plays a middle-value card to appear more credible, hoping to trick an opponent into thinking it's the AI's best card.
explanations.probe_sacrificial: A high-level bait. The AI intentionally plays its second-best card to hide an even better one (like the Ace of Spades), setting a trap for a later Truco call.
explanations.probe_envido_hide: A deceptive play. The AI has high Envido points and plays a card that is NOT part of its Envido combination to mislead the opponent about its hand composition.
explanations.accept_truco_do_or_die: A forced move. The AI is about to lose the game. Folding guarantees defeat, so accepting is the only option, regardless of hand strength.
explanations.decline_truco_weak: A standard fold. The AI's hand is weak, and the opponent's call is credible. The AI folds to minimize point loss.
explanations.decline_truco_low_equity: A calculated fold. The AI's simulations and equity calculation show a very low probability of winning the round, making folding the correct play.
explanations.decline_truco_certain_loss: A logical fold. The AI has calculated that it is mathematically impossible to win the round, so it folds to avoid losing more points.
explanations.accept_truco_solid: A standard call. The AI's hand is strong enough to compete, so it accepts the opponent's Truco bet.
explanations.accept_truco_decent_equity: A calculated call. The AI's simulations show a reasonable chance of winning, making the bet profitable to accept.
explanations.accept_truco_bluff_call: A strategic call. The AI's hand is weak, but it suspects the opponent is bluffing based on their behavior. It accepts to challenge the bluff.
explanations.escalate_truco_high_equity: A value raise. The AI's equity is very high, indicating a strong advantage. It raises the bet to maximize points.
explanations.escalate_truco_strong: A value raise. The AI has a very strong hand and raises the bet.
explanations.escalate_truco_elite: A confident raise. The AI has an elite, top-tier hand and is aggressively raising the bet for maximum value.
explanations.escalate_truco_bluff: A strategic bluff. The AI is raising the bet with a weak hand, hoping to intimidate the opponent into folding.
explanations.escalate_truco_weak_bluff: A semi-bluff. The hand is weak, but the situation or opponent's tendencies make a bluff escalation a potentially profitable move.
explanations.escalate_truco_desperation_bluff: A last-resort bluff. The AI is in a losing position and attempts a high-risk, high-reward bluff to try and steal the round.
explanations.call_truco_bluff: The AI is initiating a Truco call with a weak hand, hoping to intimidate the opponent into folding.
explanations.call_truco_won_trick1: The AI won the first trick, giving it a significant strategic advantage. It's now calling Truco to capitalize on this position.
explanations.call_truco_certain_win: The AI has calculated that its victory in the round is guaranteed based on the cards left. It calls Truco to maximize points.
explanations.call_truco_post_parda_bluff: After a tie in the first trick, the AI is bluffing with Truco, leveraging the uncertainty of the situation.
explanations.call_envido_strong: The AI has a high Envido score and is calling to win points.
explanations.call_envido_bluff: The AI has a low Envido score but is calling as a bluff, hoping the opponent folds.
explanations.call_envido_marginal: The AI has a mediocre Envido score but is making a speculative call based on game state or opponent tendencies.
explanations.call_real_dominant: The AI has a dominant Envido score (30+) and is escalating to 'Real Envido' for more points.
explanations.call_falta_win_game: The AI is close to winning the match and has a very high Envido. It calls 'Falta Envido' to try and win the game immediately.
explanations.call_falta_defensive: The AI calls 'Falta Envido' as a defensive measure, often when the opponent is close to winning, to raise the stakes.
explanations.decline_envido_weak: The AI's Envido score is too low to compete, so it folds.
explanations.accept_envido_good_odds: The AI's Envido score is good enough to have a positive expectation of winning, so it accepts.
explanations.accept_envido_hero_call: The AI's Envido is weak, but it suspects a bluff from the opponent and makes a 'hero call'.
explanations.escalate_real_stronger: The opponent called Envido, but the AI's score is significantly higher, so it escalates to 'Real Envido'.
explanations.escalate_envido_strong: The opponent called Envido, and the AI also has a strong hand, so it escalates by calling 'Envido' again (Envido-Envido).
explanations.call_flor_strong: The AI has Flor and is obligated to call it.
explanations.ack_flor_weak: The opponent called Flor. The AI also has Flor but believes it's weaker, so it folds the Flor duel ('Con flor me achico').
explanations.ack_flor_no_flor: The opponent called Flor, and the AI doesn't have it, so it concedes the points.
explanations.call_contraflor_strong: The opponent called Flor, but the AI also has Flor and believes its score is very high, so it escalates to 'Contraflor'.
explanations.accept_contraflor_strong: The opponent called Contraflor. The AI's Flor is very strong, so it accepts the challenge.
explanations.decline_contraflor_weak: The opponent called Contraflor. The AI's Flor is not strong enough to risk the high-stakes duel, so it folds.
explanations.win_round_cheap: The AI can win the current trick and has identified the weakest card in its hand that can still win. It plays this card to save stronger ones for later.
explanations.discard_low: The AI cannot win the current trick, so it plays its lowest-value card to minimize its losses.
explanations.parda_y_canto: A classic tactic. The AI intentionally plays a card that ties the trick, hiding its stronger cards and setting up a favorable situation to call Truco later.
explanations.unknown_action: The AI's action did not match a predefined reason key. This may indicate a new strategy or a fallback case.
explanations.accept_truco_lookahead_fold: The AI's hand is good enough to accept the Truco, but its internal simulation shows it would fold to a 'Retruco'. It accepts cautiously.
explanations.escalate_truco_dominant_card: The AI is in the final trick and holds a card that is guaranteed to win. It escalates the Truco bet for maximum value.
explanations.accept_truco_mixed: As part of a mixed strategy to be less predictable, the AI is accepting despite the odds being borderline.
explanations.decline_truco_mixed: As part of a mixed strategy, the AI is folding a borderline hand to avoid being too predictable.
explanations.escalate_truco_mixed_bluff: As part of a mixed strategy, the AI is bluff-escalating to keep the opponent guessing.
explanations.play_last_card: The AI is simply playing the last card remaining in its hand.
explanations.call_truco_value: The AI's hand strength is above its value threshold. It's calling Truco because it believes it has a high probability of winning.
explanations.call_truco_parda_y_gano: The first trick was a tie. The AI knows that winning the second trick wins the round, and it has a guaranteed winning card. It calls Truco for risk-free points.
explanations.secure_hand: The AI is 'mano' (leading) or has already won a trick. It plays its strongest card to secure the trick and maintain control of the round.
explanations.respond_with_flor: The opponent called Envido, but the AI has Flor. Flor has priority and voids the Envido bet, so the AI must call it.
explanations.respond_truco_with_flor: The opponent called Truco, but the AI has Flor. The Flor must be resolved before the Truco continues.
explanations.bait_lopsided_hand: The AI has a strong Envido but weak Truco cards. It plays a low card silently, hoping the opponent calls Envido so it can counter-raise for more points.
explanations.feint_pre_truco: The AI has a monster hand. Instead of calling Truco and scaring the opponent, it plays a weaker card as bait to induce a bluff or a call from the opponent.
explanations.feint_active_truco: A Truco is already active. The AI has a monster hand and plays a weak card to appear vulnerable, hoping the opponent will escalate the bet into the AI's trap.
